text: just because it's spring doesn't mean
you have to stop eating soup I mean
maybe you weren't thinking time to stop
eating soup but some people do I like to
continue to eat soup all year long cold
soups and some are light fresh soups in
the spring and hearty err soups in the
winter so today I'm making a light fresh
soup for spring it's a leek potato and
green bean soup and to brighten it up at
the end
a delicious parsley oil that I'm going
to make in a few minutes start off by
cleaning your leeks leeks are one of
those things that you absolutely have to
wash no matter what they look like on
the outside there could be hidden grit
hiding between the leaves so cut your
leeks first I find that this is the best
way to get a really good clean leek I
have two leeks they're kind of large and
the recipe calls for medium so I'm not
using the entire thing take your leeks
and wash them in a big bowl of cold
water once they're cut up the water will
be able to get between all of the leaves
and you have more of an opportunity to
make sure that it all comes out so once
your leeks have cleaned and you swish
them around in the water as much as
possible lift them out shake off the
excess liquid and then dry on paper
towels or a clean kitchen towel get them
as dry as possible before you start to
saute heat a medium saucepan over
medium-high heat and add a couple
teaspoons of olive oil keeping it light
there's going to be some oil in the

little as possible for sauteing your
lead saute them until they're
translucent
three to six minutes you can see them a
little bit right now we can you talk
some pepper
if you don't have leek or you don't like
Lee you can also use a bunch of

you have pomade even better but
store-bought will do and then one and a
half pounds of russet potatoes cut into
half inch cubes peeled of course it's
basically a potato leek soup but it's
not going to be pureed it's nice and
chunky bring this to a boil reduce it to
a simmer and cook until the potatoes are
tender that should take about 10 minutes
and while you're doing that you can ABP
and get your parsley oil ready this is
going to really brighten up your soup
and spring a PHY it even more I'm making
it with parsley but you could use
cilantro any soft herbs will do you can
use them in combination with the parsley
or on their own make sure your parsley
is clean this is a no grit soup I'm just
going to talk about grit non-stop you
don't want gritty parsley gritty parsley
gritty leeks stay away from the grid you
don't need to get rid of all the stems
but get rid of the big stems and then
puree your parsley with a little bit of
oil and I like to add a little bit of
salt too it's kind of like making a
pesto but no not - no cheese nothing
like that just a simple herb puree you
need a little bit of oil maybe about a
tablespoon or four just kidding and a
little bit of salt
for easier usability transfer it to a
